title: Biosecurity Survey - Cattle
completedHtml:
Thank you for completing this biosecurity survey!

If new animals were introduced to your farm in the last year, answer the Animal Movements Survey to complete the risk assessment.

To ensure an accurate risk assessment, please remember to update it if there are any changes on your farm.

choices.text: Peloponnese, Western Greece and the Ionian Islands

elements.name: pilot
user_id
elements.description: Always use the same alias (e.g. "nat"). Use only lower case and underscores.

elements.name: farm_id
elements.description: Use a name that allows you to remember which farm you are referring to (e.g. "dairy_lleida_joan"). Use only lower case and underscores.

elements.title: Pilot survey
elements.description: Please provide the following information for the pilot data processing. Use only lower case and underscores in the text inputs.

elements.name: farm_site
elements.title: Does the farm have multiple sites?
elements.description: e.g. cows and heifers are housed in different stalls.

elements.name: farm_epiunit
elements.title: Are the different sites part of a single epidemiological unit?
elements.description: i.e. animals from the different sites could easily share pathogens by direct or indirect contact

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Include all the animals in the epidemiological unit
elements.description: even if they are in diferent sites

elements.name: farm_other
elements.title: Are there other domestic species on the farm?
elements.description: Sheep, goats, pigs, poultry, dogs, cats, horses...

elements.name: farm_other_contact
elements.title: Which species have direct contact with cattle?

elements.name: farm_other_entry
elements.title: Have there been any entries of small ruminants in the last year?

elements.name: quarantine_area
elements.title: When new cattle enter the farm, are they isolated from the herd (quarantine)?

elements.name: quarantine_direct
elements.title: Can isolated animals come into direct contact with other cattle in the herd?

elements.name: quarantine_time
elements.title: Average duration of quarantine in days

elements.name: quarantine_visits
elements.title: What time of day is the quarantine visited?

choices.text: At the end of the day
At any time of the day

elements.name: quarantine_frequency
elements.title: How often is the quarantine visited?

choices.text: A few times during the period of quarantine

elements.name: quarantine_equipment
elements.title: Is quarantine equipment shared with the rest of the herd?

elements.name: quarantine_cleaning
elements.title: Is equipment cleaned after each use?

elements.name: quarantine_disinfection
elements.title: Is equipment disinfected after each use?

elements.name: fattening_external
elements.title: Do you fatten calves from other farms?

elements.name: fattening_time
elements.title: Average duration of fattening in months

elements.name: fattening_direct
elements.title: Can fattening calves come into direct contact with other cattle?

elements.name: fattening_indirect
elements.title: Is fattening equipment, clothing or personnel, shared with the rest of the herd?

elements.name: fattening_frequency
elements.title: If equipment and personnel are shared, how often can there be indirect contact between fattening animals and the rest of the herd?

choices.text: A few times during fattening period

elements.name: neighbour_farms
elements.title: Are there other cattle farms within a 1-2km radius?

elements.name: neighbour_n
elements.title: Number of cattle farms in  1-2 km radius
elements.description: From any location of your farm

elements.name: neighbour_direct
elements.title: Is it possible for your livestock to have direct contact with livestock on neighbouring farms?

elements.name: outdoors_fencing_type
elements.title: What type of fencing does the farm have?

elements.name: outdoors_fencing_perimeter
elements.title: Does the farm have a complete perimeter fence?
elements.description: i.e. a continuous fence that surrounds the entire farm

elements.name: outdoors_fencing_wildlife
elements.title: Can terrestrial wildlife access the farm?
elements.description: i.e. wild boar, red deer, etc.

elements.name: outdoors_waterpoints_access
elements.title: Are there water points accessible to wildlife (in the outdoor grazing area)?

elements.name: outdoors_waterpoints
elements.visibleIf: {outdoors_access} = true and {outdoors_fencing_wildlife} = true or {outdoors_fencing_perimeter} = false and {outdoors_waterpoints_access} = true
elements.title: What type of water points are available?

elements.name: outdoors_waterpoints_types_n
elements.title: Number of visit water point types

elements.name: outdoors_waterpoints_p
elements.visibleIf: {outdoors_access} = true and {outdoors_fencing_wildlife} = true or {outdoors_fencing_perimeter} = false and {outdoors_waterpoints_access} = true
elements.title: What percentage of the time do the cows use each type of water point?

elements.name: outdoors_mud
elements.title: Is there usually mud around the waterers?

elements.name: outdoors_mud_p
elements.title: What is the percentage of waterers with mud around them?

elements.name: outdoor_comments
elements.title: Comments about neighbours and outdoor facilities (optional)

elements.name: pasture_goes
elements.title: Do livestock go seasonally to pasture? (transhumance)

elements.name: pasture_same
elements.title: Do animals always go to the same pastures?

elements.name: pasture_n
elements.title: To how many diferent pastures do the animals go?
elements.maxErrorText: You can only register up to {0} pastures. Please register the {0} pastures you go to most often.

templateElements.name: pasture_name
templateElements.title: Pasture name
templateElements.description: A name to identify this pasture in the movements survey

templateElements.name: pasture_waterpoints
templateElements.title: What type of water points are available?

templateElements.name: pasture_waterpoints_types_n
templateElements.title: Number of visit water point types

templateElements.name: pasture_waterpoints_p
templateElements.title: What percentage of the time do the cows use each type of water point?

templateElements.name: pasture_mud
templateElements.title: Is there usually mud around the waterers?

templateElements.name: pasture_mud_p
templateElements.title: What is the percentage of waterers with mud around them?

elements.name: visit_list
elements.title: Who enters the barn or comes into contact with the cattle?

choices.text: Farm workers that own livestock or work on other farms
Farmer that visits other farms (e.g. for purchasing animals)

templateElements.name: visit_type
templateElements.title: Type of visitor
templateElements.defaultValueExpression:
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==0, {visit_list[0]}, 
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==1, {visit_list[1]}, 
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==2, {visit_list[2]},
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==3, {visit_list[3]},
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==4, {visit_list[4]},
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==5, {visit_list[5]},
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==6, {visit_list[6]},
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==7, {visit_list[7]},
iif({panel.visit_panel_n}==8, {visit_list[8]},'error'))

templateElements.name: visit_frequency
templateElements.title: Visit frequency
templateElements.description: Select the shortest time period applicable

choices.text: Daily or several times a week
At least several times a year

templateElements.name: visit_livestock_type
templateElements.title: What type of livestock they own or work with?

templateElements.name: visit_boots_cleaning
templateElements.title: If they use their own boots, are they clean and disinfected when they enter the farm?

templateElements.name: visit_equipment_enter
templateElements.title: Do they bring their own equipment that they have used on other farms?

templateElements.name: visit_equipment_cleaning
templateElements.title: If they use their own equipment, is it clean and disinfected when they enter the farm?

elements.name: visit_veh_list
elements.title: What vehicles enter into the farm perimeter?

templateElements.name: visit_veh_type
templateElements.title: Type of vehicle
templateElements.defaultValueExpression:
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==0, {visit_veh_list[0]}, 
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==1, {visit_veh_list[1]}, 
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==2, {visit_veh_list[2]},
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==3, {visit_veh_list[3]},
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==4, {visit_veh_list[4]},
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==5, {visit_veh_list[5]},
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==6, {visit_veh_list[6]},
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==7, {visit_veh_list[7]},
iif({panel.visit_veh_panel_n}==8, {visit_veh_list[8]},'error'))

templateElements.name: visit_veh_own
templateElements.title: Is it a vehicle that you own and do not share with anyone?
templateElements.description: i.e. only animals from your farm use it

choices.text: Daily or several times a week
At least several times a year

templateElements.name: visit_veh_direct
templateElements.title: Does the driver come into contact with your animals?

templateElements.name: visit_veh_boots_cleaning
templateElements.title: If they use their own boots, are they clean and disinfected when they enter the farm?

elements.name: veh_farm
elements.title: Does the farm have its own vehicles for animal transport?

elements.name: veh_n
elements.title: Number of vehicles
elements.maxErrorText: You can only register up to {0} vehicles. Please register the {0} vehicles you use most often.

templateElements.name: veh_name
templateElements.title: Vehicle name (veh_name)
templateElements.description: A name to identify this vehicle in the movements survey

templateElements.name: veh_otherfarms
templateElements.title: Is the vehicle shared with other ruminant farms?

choices.text: Each time the vehicle is used

elements.name: complete_comments
elements.title: Additional comments and feedback about the Demo survey
